intro: Borreria laxa, commonly known as the Mexican milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in clusters, often in late spring to early summer. Borreria laxa is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and open woodlands. It is also known for its milky sap, which is a distinguishing feature of the genus Borreria.
